channel.title: CVE Feed for golang.org/x/image -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for golang.org/x/image -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-29407|2024-10-17T18:44:42.693Z -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage%2Ftiff
item.description: A maliciously-crafted image can cause excessive CPU consumption in decoding. A tiled image with a height of 0 and a very large width can cause excessive CPU consumption, despite the image size (width * height) appearing to be zero.

item.title: CVE-2023-29408|2024-10-17T18:46:21.200Z -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage%2Ftiff
item.description: The TIFF decoder does not place a limit on the size of compressed tile data. A maliciously-crafted image can exploit this to cause a small image (both in terms of pixel width/height, and encoded size) to make the decoder decode large amounts of compressed data, consuming excessive memory and CPU.

item.title: CVE-2024-24792|2024-07-18T15:22:35.789Z -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage%2Ftiff
item.description: Parsing a corrupt or malicious image with invalid color indices can cause a panic.

item.title: CVE-2024-24792|2024-06-27T17:37:38.560Z -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage -- golang.org%2Fx%2Fimage%2Ftiff
item.description: Parsing a corrupt or malicious image with invalid color indices can cause a panic.
